forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy. Low around 52, with temperatures rising to around 54 overnight. South wind around 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely. Partly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 6 to 9 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the night has settled in with a persistent drizzle, painting the streets in a glistening sheen. The air carries the crisp scent of rain, intertwining with the faint remnants of warmth as temperatures hover just above fifty. Clouds blanket the sky, offering a soft gray hue, casting a subtle, ethereal quality over familiar landmarks. As dawn approaches, the rain is forecasted to transition to a brief interlude of partly sunny skies, though the chill of autumn will linger, promising a high of fifty-eight before nudging downwards in the afternoon. 

With the winds whispering from the southwest, it may be a good day for a light jacket and comfortable shoes, perhaps a stroll along the Embarcadero to admire the reflections in the puddles or savor a warm cup at a local café. The day looks to balance between a touch of sunshine and the remnants of yesterday's rain, so an umbrella may still be a wise companion. The bay's usual fog may find its way in as the day progresses, ensuring that the classic San Francisco marine layer adds its own touch of mystery to the landscape. Embrace the cozy intimacy of this weather and allow the gentle rhythm of the rain to guide your day’s thoughts and activities.
